sections.title: Gentle, staged movements mapped in advance
sections.body: Clear aligners use a series of custom trays to guide teeth into position. Each stage is planned digitally, so you know the expected movements, check-in cadence, and how to care for trays day to day, with options to align shade through whitening (/treatments/teeth-whitening) or plan veneers (/treatments/veneers) once alignment is stable.

faqs.question: How much do clear aligners cost?
faqs.answer: Fees depend on complexity and length of treatment; we outline a range after assessing your teeth and the expected number of stages.

faqs.question: How long will I wear aligners?
faqs.answer: Most mild to moderate cases run for several months to over a year; we share a projected timeline and review it at each check-in.

faqs.question: Will aligners hurt?
faqs.answer: You may feel pressure or mild soreness for a few days when switching trays; it typically eases with consistent wear.

faqs.question: Can I eat and drink with aligners in?
faqs.answer: Remove aligners for meals and anything other than still water to avoid staining or warping the trays.

faqs.question: What are attachments?
faqs.answer: Small tooth-coloured bumps that help guide movement. We explain placement, visibility, and care before adding them.

faqs.question: Will I speak differently?
faqs.answer: Some patients notice a slight lisp for a few days. Speech usually settles as you adapt to the trays.

faqs.question: What if I lose an aligner?
faqs.answer: Contact the clinic quickly. We’ll advise whether to move to the next tray, use a previous one, or order a replacement.

faqs.question: Do I need retainers after treatment?
faqs.answer: Yes. Retainers hold your new tooth positions and reduce relapse risk. We’ll agree a wear schedule and maintenance plan.
